headline: Is It Too Late to Chase Masimo Stock on Major Danaher News?
summary: Masimo stock rallies as Danaher announces plans of buying the health tech firm for $180 a share in cash. But is there any further upside left in MASI shares?

raw.headline: Is It Too Late to Chase Masimo Stock on Major Danaher News?

headline: How Recent Developments Are Reframing The Danaher (DHR) Investment Story
summary: Why Danaher’s Price Target Just Nudged in the Other Direction Danaher’s fair value estimate has been reset slightly lower to about US$264.91 from roughly US$265.23, a small move that still keeps the stock’s modeled value in the mid US$260s. This fine tuning lines up with recent Street research, where several bullish analysts have clustered price targets in a similar range after updating their views on life science tools peers. If you care about how these small shifts can reshape the story...

headline: Danaher’s $9.9B Masimo Deal Marks One of 2026’s Largest Medtech Buyouts
summary: Danaher (NYSE: DHR) is acquiring Masimo (NASDAQ: MASI) for $9.9 billion in an all-cash deal that values the medical technology company at $180 per share. The transaction, announced February 17, 2026, represents a nearly 40% premium over Masimo’s closing price on Friday, February 13, 2026. What Masimo Brings to the Table Masimo specializes in pulse ... Danaher’s $9.9B Masimo Deal Marks One of 2026’s Largest Medtech Buyouts

headline: Danaher Nears $10 Billion Masimo Deal, FT Reports
summary: Financial Times says acquisition could be announced Tuesday, valuing Masimo at a premium to its nearly $7B market cap.

headline: Masimo (MASI) Climbs 34% on $9.9-Billion Danaher Merger
summary: We recently published 10 Stocks Outperforming With Monstrous Gains. Masimo Corporation (NASDAQ:MASI) was one of the best performers on Tuesday. Masimo Corp. snapped a two-day losing streak on Tuesday, soaring 34.22 percent to finish at $174.69 apiece as investors snapped up shares following news that it was set to merge with Danaher Corp. for $9.9 […]
